subject: Joining Sasquan
event:
The Hugo Awards, the center of the controversy that has plunged all fandom into war, will be awarded this summer at Sasquan, the 2015 World Science Fiction in Spokane, Washington.

I have been going to Worldcons for a long time.  My icon is a picture of me at Torcon II, the 1973 Worldcon in Toronto, where I lost the very first John W. Campbell Award for Best New Writer.  Wasn't I cute?  It was my second Worldcon, following on Noreascon I in Boston in 1971.  (I missed LA in 1972).

You can be a part of Worldcon too.  Just go here:

https://sasquan.swoc.us/sasquan/reg.php

You can buy a Supporting Membership for $40, which will give you the right to vote on this year's Hugo Awards.  Whether you vote for the Sad Puppies, or for the Rabid Puppies, or against the Puppies, or vote NO AWARD on everything, or read the work and vote on what you like, or abstain, or elect some combination of all of those... that's up to you.  The important thing is that you vote, however you think best.

Even better, you can buy an ATTENDING membership, and actually come to the convention.  Usually they are a lot of fun.  That's why I keep coming back.  Don't believe what you may have heard, we will not be parading about with the heads of puppies impaled on spears.  

Come to the party.  Everyone is welcome.  Don't believe anyone who tells you otherwise.

comments.article: Sadly won't be able to attend this year, as isn't just a few hundred miles down the road like last year. But supporting membership will definitely happen this time around. Too much going on to complain remotely without acting.

Hi mr Martin first time poster here

I don't know a lot about the Hugo scene but after reading how passionate you are about them It has got me interested. I also really appericiate your civilty and willingness to talk to the other side , the world could do with more of this attitude.
While there will be no heads of puppies impaled on spears being paraded about, perhaps there will be a Dire Wolf or two, yeah?  Something all sides can rally around.
comments.subject: Impaled animals

comments.article:
Purchasing an attending membership and coming dressed as Harma Dogshead would be in poor taste?

Psh, talk about buzzkill. :P
comments.subject: So...

comments.article: You might win the Masquerade.  You'd make a lot of enemies, though... and maybe a few friends as well.
comments.subject: Re: So...

comments.article:
Would love to attend, if only to be a barfly in the evenings and listen to the chatter from other attendees. I wish all sides luck, and a harmonious gathering. Who knows maybe some progress can come from all this rancor. Hope springs eternal someone once said.....

Less politics - more awesome fiction folks! Let's keep our priorities straight!! :)
comments.subject: Thanks for the invite

comments.article:
I'm no Sad Puppy - at least not when it comes to my fiction tastes - and I've just registered for my first WorldCon as a supporting member. Woo hoo!
-∇
comments.subject: I'm in

comments.article: Forgive me for going off topic but it is certainly a shock seeing a photo of you without a beard.
comments.subject: beard

comments.article:
we will not be parading about with the heads of puppies impaled on spears.

You never let us have any fun...

See you there, I hope.

I admire your approach going forward. Not only are you my favorite author, favorite Social Justice Warrior, but also my favorite human. We should all try to live our ethics by the examples we set. In other words you are an excellent living example of morals and ethics i hold dear and man is that cool that you also are the creator of some of the most evocative and eloquent fictional prose to ever grace a page! Super GURM!! YOU. ROCK! Now, i hope no more Puppy-hype steals valuable TWoW creating time. DOWN PUPPIES! DOWN!
comments.subject: admiration to the GRRM OF THEN AND NOW

comments.article:
Thanks for promoting the link to the supporting membership signup page - I was beginning to wonder why no one on the anti-Puppy side was doing that. In all this kerfuffle, I haven't seen any variation of the sentiment, "What a golden opportunity to get more people involved in sci-fi fandom."

By the by, does anyone else find it amusing that the phrase, "a sudden influx of new Hugo voters" describes a) the perceived injustice that rallied the puppies in to existence, b) the puppies themselves, and c) the most obvious solution to the damage they've caused?
I know we have many friends in common. I hope to see you at Sasquan and we can raise a glass to the genre we love. I am travelling halfway around the world for this. I will not have it spoiled.
Usually when I look at pictures from 30 years ago, I say "You had more hair back then." In your case, you actually had less hair back then.
And I bought a supporting membership for my stepdad.  I'm hoping he'll want to upgrade and come along.  Least I could do for the guy, he sent me your books.  :)
comments.subject: I'll see you there

comments.article:
Would love to come. But its a long way from Boston. I have a couple of Daleks that like to go to these things on occasion as well. They know a thing or two about dealing with sad puppies.

I think we should all create characters called some variation on Vox Day and kill them off in the most gruesome fashion possible.
comments.subject: If only it wasn't the other end of the country

comments.upictitle: louise danger: doctor: donna wish i could be
comments.article: Ahh, but if there were puppy heads on spears, you could tell everyone, in a conspiratorial whisper, "the Worldcon remembers."

Actually, I have abandoned that idea for a completely new plot in which a pair of Hollywood producers are making a hit series in which characters are being slaughtered at a prodigious rate.

Things take a turn for the worse however when the writer of the series is distracted by an attempt to rig the voting in a writing contest he has won previously. How do they get him back to the word processor?

Desperate to ensure renewal of the contract that is making them rich, each producer independently decides to remedy the situation in the fashion of one of the show's characters.
comments.subject: A new plot entirely

comments.article:
I'll be there. If not, I'll Blame Pod!!

:)

Thanks for the easy linkage!  It certainly will be an adventure, I just hope my schedule will allow it.  I think once folks meet face to face, the majority are just going to share their love and appreciation for SFF.  Good luck to the nominees!
comments.subject: Over 7000 Sasquan members!

comments.article: The Old and the New bless you for this post, ser.

I doubt I can make it to the con, but I'll take out a membership to fight the good fight. Very appreciative of your leadership on this. As I mentioned in another thread, the voting system used for the nominations is extremely prone to this sort of gaming. The Hugos badly need to switch to something like single transferable vote. Bloc voting is awful.

Thanks again for your work here, and of course for all your other work.
This will be my very first Worldcon ever, and I'm not going to let any puppies ruin it for me.
Any chance you post a larger version ? It'd be cool to see what you looked like when you were younger. That mustard-colored sweater though :P
comments.subject: That pic

comments.article:
I also had a mustard yellow pin-striped double-breasted sports jacket that I wore on formal occasions. It made for a striking ensemble with my burgundy polyester bell bottoms and my black satin apache scarf.

(And Larry Correia calls me one of the 'cool kids.' Pff).
comments.subject: Re: That pic

comments.article: I attended both multiple times, and tell everyone the same thing. Two events to experience before you die: Burning Man and Worldcon. Doesn't matter who you are or what your interests are. They will change you while you have a great time.
comments.subject: Two events

comments.article: I bought my attending membership before all this Hugo stuff happened, though it was too late to nominate when I did. I have gone to a small con before this, but it's really my first foray into fandom. I'm nervous for my first Worldcon. I get nervous for things like this. It seems like a really weird time to be entering fandom though. I was so excited to vote for the Hugos for the first time and then all this stuff happened. I don't quite know what to think. I have loved SF/F my whole life, and all I can think is that I have to read everything and vote according to what resonates and what doesn't. I am a little bit more nervous for the con now though.  Despite that, I'm determined to go and have an amazing time.

Cue Mungo Jerry, "In the summertime"...

Down in Westeros, when the winter is nigh
We all play the game where you win or you die
When the kings are restless, we’ve got treachery and murder on our minds
Have a drink, call the banners and go out where human life ain’t worth a dime

If you’re daddy’s rich, you’ll be ransomed for gold
If your daddy’s poor, you won’t live to grow old
If you’re somewhere in the middle, you go anywhere you have the wherewithal
Take a risk, hey, you only live once (unless you’re north of the wall)

We all justify any means to our ends
And we’re conquering enemies and stabbing our friends
Have a war, call a truce, pledge your fealty for better or for worse
And we’ll all have our food-tasters drink each other’s health to slake our thirst

Sing along with us, oh-de doo-dah-day
Da-da-dah-dah-dah, yeah we’re DOA
If your king or your general’s an asshole there’s no need to sing the blues
‘Cause the odds are, he’s only gonna be alive another page or two

When the winter comes, then it’s all downhill
If the Starks don’t get you, then the Lannisters will
You might fall in love, get married and mayhaps you’ll settle down
But if your wedding band plays “The Rains of Castermere”, get out of town

Down in Westeros, when the winter is nigh
We all play the game where you win or you die
When the kings are restless, we’ve got treachery and murder on our minds
Have a drink, call the banners and go out where human life ain’t worth a dime

If your daddy’s married, there's no trouble at all
If your daddy’s single, you can go to the wall
If you’ve got a cute sibling, go ahead and propagate the family tree
Take a risk, life’s too short--—here, we’ll show you! Yeah, that’s our philosophy

Some day all of us will kill each other and then
We’ll become white walkers and we’ll do it again
When Daenerys comes, she’ll find a wasteland here with nothing left to burn
She’ll turn around with her dragons and take off, and she’ll make her way to Pern!

Sing along with us, oh-de doo-dah-day
Da-da-dah-dah-dah, yeah we’re DOA...

Love it.

That lead singer for Mungo Jerry still holds the record for "Scariest Sideburns This Side of A Werewolf."
Awe what a cutie! Perfect throwback Thursday :)
